item.title: A resolution urging the people of the United States to observe Global Family Day and One Day of Peace and Sharing on January 1, 2010.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S14138-14139)

item.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S11607)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S11607)

summary.text:
Requests the people of the United States to: (1) observe Global Family Day and One Day of Peace and Sharing with activities stressing the need to eradicate violence, hunger, and poverty; and (2) establish greater fellowship among peace-loving countries and families everywhere.

Requests American businesses, labor organizations, and faith and civic leaders to join in promoting activities for Americans and in extending greetings from the families of the United States to families in the rest of the world.

bill.title: A resolution urging the people of the United States to observe Global Family Day and One Day of Peace and Sharing.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
